dmca.title: DMCA complaint v Funnypart.com 70.85.74.178
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Kat Caverly [mailto:mom@noevilproductions.com] 
Sent: Monday, July 25, 2005 5:50 PM
To: Legal Response
Subject: Re: DMCA complaint v Funnypart.com 70.85.74.178

To whom it may concern,

I have identified the material as the "animated cartoon short Juiceball".
This animation was the only animation on the URL:

http://www.funnypart.com/funny_flash/juiceball.shtml  (this page has
Juiceball as a title in bold above the swf file one the page)

Infringing Filename Location: /openfile/FunnyPart-com-juiceball.swf

I have provided the server path to the .swf file which is the actual
material, the animation titled "Juiceball".

This information is in the original DMCA complaint and does substantially
comply with the required notification elements.

I have also included attached screenshots identifying the material. They are
attached again. This information is straight forward and compliant. Please
advise regarding your action to assure me that the content has not only been
removed from those pages but that the swf file located above has been
removed from the server.

Kat Caverly
Producer/ceo
No Evil Productions
Registered copyright owner of Juiceball



On 7/25/05 4:35 PM, "Legal Response" <legal-response@theplanet.com> wrote:

> To Whom It May Concern:
> 
> Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does 
> not substantially comply with the required notification elements of 
> the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 (
dmca.principal_name: No Evil Productions/Kat Caverly Enterprises Inc.
